DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this prospective, case series is to evaluate the surgical treatment of painful and disabling osteoarthrosis in the MTP-I joint by insertion of an Artelon MTP Spacer.
DOC.criteria: The patient experiences pain and limitations of the great toe dorsiflexion at the MTPI joint. The patient has a clinically and radiographically verified arthritis in the MTPI joint indicating the need for surgical treatment. The patient reads, understands and is able to complete the study questionnaires in Swedish. The patient has received written and oral information regarding the study and has signed the informed consent form. Exclusion criteria: The patient has a pronounced hallux rigidus without mobility in the MTPI joint (ROM = 0Â°). The patient has previously received surgical treatment affecting the anatomy of the MTPI joint. The patient has a systemic rheumatic disease, ongoing infection, hallux valgus or is seriously ill.
